quiz.title: Foundations of Algebra (Quiz 6)
quiz.subtitle: Section 1.6: Combining Like Terms (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Simplifying Expressions by Combining Like Terms

questions.question: What are 'like terms' in an algebraic expression?
options: Terms that are next to each other
questions.explanation: Like terms have exactly the same variables raised to exactly the same exponents. The coefficients can be different.

questions.question: Simplify: 5x + 3x
questions.explanation: 5x and 3x are like terms (same variable x). Add coefficients: 5 + 3 = 8, keep the variable: 8x.

questions.question: What is 4y - 9y?
questions.explanation: 4y and -9y are like terms. Subtract coefficients: 4 - 9 = -5, keep the variable: -5y.

questions.question: Simplify: 2a + 3b - a + 5b
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: a terms: 2a - a = a; b terms: 3b + 5b = 8b. Different variables stay separate: a + 8b.

questions.question: What is 7 + 2x - 3 + x?
questions.explanation: Constants: 7 - 3 = 4. x terms: 2x + x = 3x. Combine results: 4 + 3x. Remember: x means 1x.

questions.question: Simplify: 3m² + 2m - m² + 4m
questions.explanation: m² terms: 3m² - m² = 2m². m terms: 2m + 4m = 6m. m² and m are NOT like terms (different exponents).

questions.question: Which terms CANNOT be combined?
questions.explanation: 4x and 4y have different variables (x vs y), so they are not like terms. All other pairs have identical variable parts.

questions.question: Simplify: 2(x + 3) + 3x
questions.explanation: First distribute: 2(x + 3) = 2x + 6. Then combine like terms: 2x + 6 + 3x = 5x + 6.

questions.question: The perimeter of a triangle is 2x + 3 + x + 4 + 3x - 1. Simplify this expression.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: x terms: 2x + x + 3x = 6x. Constants: 3 + 4 - 1 = 6. So: 6x + 6.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered identifying and combining like terms in various expressions.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the concept but review terms with different exponents and distribution.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: 1) Identify like terms (same variables, same exponents), 2) Combine coefficients, 3) Keep variables unchanged.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember: Only combine terms with identical variable parts. Constants combine with constants.
